results.title: Back to the brickworks
results.brief_description: In the 1800s, brickmaking was one of the largest manufacturing industries in Australia. Hoffman’s Brickworks in Brunswick, Victoria, was a leader of this industry, running for 133 years and fostering a strong union. Indeed Hoffman’s was the birthplace of the Brickmaker’s Union in Victoria. In this film, director Grant Hobson covers the final week of operation of this historic site, in December 1993. He interviews the union representatives and the close family of workers, some of whom he is able to reunite in May 2010 on the site. It is a nostalgic reflection on the heyday and demise of brickmaking in Victoria, as well as capturing the colourful personalities that illustrate the post-war migrant experience in relation to work and settling in Melbourne.

results.title: Arthur and Corinne Cantrill interview
results.brief_description:
Arthur and Corinne Cantrill have been making films together since 1960. Initially focusing on documentaries about art they moved on to experimental film in 1969. From 1971 to 2000 they edited and published Cantrills Filmnotes, a journal on film and video art. Their film work and publishing are well-known internationally and have been represented in several film collections.

In this interview with Fiona Trigg, ACMI Exhibitions Assistant Curator, Arthur and Corinne talk about their early days of expanded cinema and their technical and creative processes.

results.title: Disney Masterclass with Roy Conli and Glen Keane
results.brief_description:
Disney Animator Glen Keane and Producer Roy Conli presented a special Masterclass sharing their behind-the-scenes insights and love of the animation process.
Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. He reflects on the inspirations for some of his characters and expressing yourself through drawing.
Roy Conli is the producer of the Disney feature animated film, ‘Tangled’, based on the story of Rapunzel. He explains the role of the producer and the line between creating a safe and fertile environment for artists and getting a film made on time and within budget.

results.title: [Celebrating the Site's Flora and Fauna]
results.brief_description: Truganina Explosives Reserve in Altona is an environmental wonderland, containing rare flora and fauna. Much of the original landscape has remained untouched for over 100 years. This takes us back to a time when it was formally landscaped, and representative of the early Edwardian planting of the late 1880s. Please enjoy a serene journey through the reserve, celebrating this unique ecosystem.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Shirley Barrett, Jan Chapman, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description:
Two bored sisters, Dimity and Vicki-Ann, live in the small country town of Sunray. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered type, formerly star D.J. of a drive-time programme on Brisbane radio, threatens to turn the sisters’ world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for 70’s music and young women. Awards: Cannes International Film Festival 1996: Camera d’Or for Shirley Barrett. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Jan Chapman ; director, writer, Shirley Barrett ; photography, Mandy Walker.
Cast: Miranda Otto, Rebecca Frith, George Shevtsov, John Alansu.

results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: This is the army
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Hal B. Wallis, Jack L. Warner, Thirtieth Cemalux, Hollywood House Video and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In World War I dancer Jerry Jones stages an all-soldier show on Broadway, called Yip Yip Yaphank. Wounded in the War, he becomes a producer. In World War II his son Johnny Jones, previously his father’s assistant, gets the order to stage a new all-soldier show, called “This is the army”. But in his personal life he has problems, because he refuses to marry his fiance until the war is over. Cast includes George Murphy, Joan Leslie, George Tobias, Alan Hale, Kate Smith, and men from the armed forces including Ronald Reagan and Joe Louis. Based on the play by Irving Berlin, music and lyrics by Irving Berlin. Includes bonus blooper footage of Ronald Reagan in rehearsal. Note: “Copyright Thirtieth Cemalux Pty Ltd 1986”

results.title: Return home [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, Cristina Pozzan and Musical Films
results.brief_description: Noel, divorced and middle-aged, takes a break from his high pressure job in a big corporation to visit his brother, who, with his wife, is struggling to hang onto a barely viable small business - a service station in Adelaide. Gary, the 19 year old apprentice is struggling to come to terms with the complexities of life as an emerging adult and befriends Noel. Before long, Noel rediscovers the pleasures of family and is revitalised. After his return to Melbourne, his brother Gary and wife Judy, reassess their own lives and begin to see their own potential. Noel eventually returns to Adelaide for good; his journey for happiness, security and a future filled with promise is finally over. Ray Argall’s direction gives form and substance to everyday lives, with a sense of naturalism apparent. Stars Dennis Coard, Frankie J. Holden, Ben Mendelsohn and Micki Camilleri. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Also available on VHS [305270].

results.title: Travelling light. Parklands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard, Helen Bowden, Soft Fruit, Showtime Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.

results.title: Japanese Story
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Alison Tilson, Sue Brooks, Sue Maslin, Film Victoria, ScreenWest, Showtime Australia, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gecko Films
results.brief_description:
Australian geologist Sandy (Toni Collette) lands the unwanted task of showing a Japanese businessman Hiromitsu (Gotaro Tsunashima) around the mines and deserts of the Pilbara, hoping to sell his company the geology software she has been co-developing. Hiromitsu mistakes her for his driver and demands they go off-road, unaware of the dangers. The two journey further into the West Australian desert, gradually leaving what they know about each other and themselves behind.

Winner of 21 Australian film awards including 8 AFI Awards. Cast also includes Matthew Dyktynski, Lynette Curran, Yumiko Tanaka, John Howard.
